meanings.definition: The belief in the importance of rural life and values.
meanings.sent1: Many people in our town hold strong ruralism beliefs.
meanings.sent2: Ruralism is about cherishing the simplicity of country living.
meanings.sent3: The city folk found the idea of ruralism amusing, thinking it was all about cows and chickens.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, ruralism seemed like a distant dream, a forgotten paradise.
meanings.sent5: Her paintings captured the essence of ruralism, with rolling fields and cozy farmhouses.

meanings.definition: The practice or way of life in rural areas.
meanings.sent1: Growing up in ruralism meant knowing all your neighbors by name.
meanings.sent2: Ruralism involves a slower pace of life compared to urban areas.
meanings.sent3: The city slicker tried to adapt to ruralism but couldn't handle the early mornings.
meanings.sent4: To him, ruralism was a sanctuary away from the chaos of the city, a peaceful retreat.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of ruralism lies in its untouched landscapes and close-knit communities.
